body.name: Collapsible Silicone Microwave Hot Air Popcorn Popper Bowl With Lid and Handles (Purple)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 7 hrs 33 mins
features: INSTANT HOMEMADE POPCORN: Enjoy making fresh, healthy, and fluffy popcorn in 2-3 min at home! You can now have your delicious popcorn from the convenience of your home or office using only your microwave. Hot and fresh and always in time, Have it ready in Just 2 – 3 minutes! Excellent for movie nights and parties!

MADE OF PREMIUM MATERIAL FOR YOUR SAFETY: Made from 100% quality food-grade, BPA free and PVC free silicone. Completely safe for your health as well. It also offers all the convenience of microwaved popcorn without unsettling chemicals that are often used in most microwave popcorn bags. No chemicals, oil or artificial addictive needed.

ECONOMICAL AND HEALTHY ALTERNATIVE: Avoid the expensive and full of preservatives popcorn products on the market and make a healthier snack at home, Popped and ready without the need to add oil if you want to enjoy your popcorn in an even healthier way. Our Microwave Popcorn Popper is the tasty, economical, and healthy alternative to those greasy and expensive microwavable popcorn.

COLLAPSIBLE FOR EASY STORAGE: If you have a small space, you can still buy this popcorn maker. Despite measuring 8.3 by 8.1 by 2.7 inches, the bowl has a convenient collapsible design where you collapse it into a much smaller size, about 2 inches in height. This feature enables you to store it comfortably in your drawer or a cupboard for the easiest future access.

MONEY BACK GUARANTEE: We are confident that you will love our big size popcorn popper that comes with suction lid and convenient handles for support. Proceed to buy with no fear, your satisfaction is guaranteed. If you are not 100% satisfied, we offer you a 30 day full money back guarantee.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So easy to make healthy popcorn now
reviews.reviewText: I was skeptical about how well this would make popcorn in the microwave. It seemed too easy to just dump popcorn in, place the lid on, and pop it in the microwave for a few minutes, but it works great! I have an electric air popper that works well but is such a pain to drag out of the cupboard, plug it in, place the bowl just right underneath the shoot, stand by while it pops so the bowl doesn't overflow... (I know - first world problems lol). I heard about these silicone poppers and thought I'd give it a try. I'm glad I did. It's just so easy to use and once you figure out the amount of time needed for your microwave (mine is about 4 min. using a 1000-watt microwave), all you have to do is hit the time and walk away until it's done. I've also tried spraying the kernels with cooking spray or popcorn oil spray and sprinkle the kernels with a seasoning before placing in the microwave. It works but sometimes it causes the popped corn to burn a little bit. Now I just spray it after it's all popped and then sprinkle the seasoning on. Because popcorn popped without oil doesn't hold salt or seasonings, the popcorn spray or cooking spray keeps the seasoning on the kernels. Makes for tasty but very healthy popcorn versus regular bags of microwave popcorn.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great afternoon snack
reviews.reviewText: This is so easy to use, store and clean. After one batch I had the timing for my microwave figured out. It is so easy to make some popcorn - with no oil - and clean up. Fast, healthy snack!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great corn popper! Really works great!
reviews.reviewText: This was suggested by a friend. I ordered one and tried it for myself. It popped great. Just a few unpopped. You have to try it with your microwave to see exactly how long to pop. I then ordered 7 more for my kids and grandkids. One in college and another going next year. My son works away part of year and stays in his travel trailer. It will be perfect for that. Love the way it folds back down and doesn’t take up much room! Another son wanted one to use in his “Man Cave” in his garage. Very useful for small cost. Be sure and save box to keep it in as the receipt is on the box!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Easy, no mess pop corn
reviews.reviewText: We've been using our pop corn bowl for about a month or two now. It's easy to use, stores easily...my only issue is the lid sections to the bowl and won't allow all of the kernels to pop, I don't mean a few I mean about 2 tbs of unpoped kernels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to clean, perfectly popped.
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for an easier way to make a movie theater tasting popcorn without the hassle of cleaning a pot and I’m happy to report this microwave popcorn bowl works very well! I kept the box to store it in because it’s floppy, but I like the fact it’s collapsible and could be stored in a drawer. It’s dishwasher safe! That’s what really won me over.No oil is needed so this could be used for a healthy snack but here’s my recipe:Melt together 1 Tbsp. Butter flavored coconut oil & 1/2 - 1 tsp. Flavacol seasoning (20-30 seconds in the microwave). Add a heaping 1/4 c. Popping Corn (kernels) to the popcorn popper bowl. Pour oil and Flavacol over kernels and combine well. Follow microwave instructions on the box. I set my timer for 3 minutes but it typically takes 1:50-2:10 in my microwave.Craving satisfied!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Works great! I have a 1.7 kw microwave if that helps anyone and I cooked mine approximately 2 minutes 30 seconds, any longer and it would have burned. Only a few kernels left in the bowl. I sprayed just a touch of the theater style butter enhancer on , just enough so some salt would stick and it tasted just like any other microwave popcorn. Got about 4&1/2 snack bags of popcorn out of it. Super easy and saves money in the long run.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quick and easy!
reviews.reviewText: 3 minutes, no oil, eating popcorn! Folds back into the low profile box for easy storage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow! Works great
reviews.reviewText: I had a previous popcorn popper with glass and plastic. No matter what I did it burned every time. So I found this product Housewares popcorn collapsible bowl. I busted it out to make some late night popcorn with ranch and white cheddar seasoning. Put in 1/4 cup and cooked it about 3 minutes in the microwave. NONE OF IT is burned!! It’s perfectly popped.

A medida que los vas usando ya la tapa que trae va quedando aguada, entonces hay que ponerla estratégicamente para que el bol no la succione y se quede atorada, haciéndo que las palomitas suban, es decir hay que poner la tapa como de lado para que las palomitas sigan creciendo

reviews.reviewTitle: Found This By Fluke and I’m AMAZED! 😱
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. My husband and I have been on the hunt for a high quality mechanical popcorn popper. During my research, I discovered this affordable microwaveable popcorn bowl. No way will this work, I thought - This must be a gimmick. So I went straight to You Tube to search videos from people who didn’t appear to be influenced, successfully using all different brands of this bowl. I couldn’t believe my eyes! How come I’ve NEVER heard of this?Fast forward and I am now a proud owner of this microwaveable bowl, and the best thing about it is, it WORKS!!! This bowl is compact and fits nicely in my kitchen drawer. I have already recommended this to a friend b/c it’s light weight & would be perfect for her RV. I would also purchase again to make movie themed gift baskets for family members. Before buying this bowl I experimented with a glass bowl. I’ll save you the curiosity by telling you it took 7 minutes to pop and I burnt most of it with many kernels left in the bowl. Hey, I had to TRY! 😝 This silicone popcorn bowl is far more superior and the price is right!🚨 So Many Brands To Choose From 🚨It’s important to note, there are MANY different brands on the market and some say you cannot put oil into the bowl while microwaving. The instructions on my box, for this Houseware brand says you can, and this is a BONUS and the main reason why I went with this particular bowl. The popcorn pops right into my butter mixture and salt, and it is AMAZING! We’ve used it almost every single day now and I’m certain my curtains, couch and dog smell like popcorn now - sorry, Boo 🐶! 🫣😫GROWING PAINS😫I have to be completely honest though. There were some growing pains with this bowl, mainly b/c my microwave is a jerk sometimes, and yours will most likely be different too. Ignore the negative reviews and experiment with your bowl to get the right time per amount you put in. The times will change depending on the amount. My best advice when starting out is to buy some popcorn in bulk. Make enough for everyone in the house; because once they smell it they will want some too. Start with 2 minutes. Stick with the same amount until you have mastered the time without burning it - and yup - you will likely burn a few batches; I personally burnt 4 batches in total. 🤭 And for me, counting 2 seconds between pops is no longer a thing b/c my popcorn was burnt by then. As you microwave your batches of popcorn (over the course of a few days), write down the amount you used, the time, and results; like you’re doing a grade 9 science experiment. Once you make a successful batch, use a post-it note & stick the times to your microwave. Do all of this and you’ll graduate to popcorn connoisseur! 👩‍🍳🔥 If you purchase this bowl and it catches fire, I’m sorry to say, it’s likely your microwave! Speaking from a bad experience at my workplace, some microwaves loathe popcorn.🤫Secret Tip🤫Psst! One more thing - during my testing period, I’ve been very successful with putting the leftover kernels that didn’t successfully pop back into the microwave. 🤫 However, once you find your perfect time, you won’t have many kernels leftover anyway - so it wouldn’t be worth your time. Enjoy!❤️My Personal Experience & Recipe❤️MICROWAVE: Panasonic Inverter Microwave. “The Genius”.POPCORN TIME: High - 2 min 05sec for 60gms (1/4 cup) popcorn kernels.Oil Mixture: 1.5 TBS Crystal Margerine, 4 turns on my salt shaker.POPCORN: Orville Redenbacher Gourmet Popping Corn.
It's ok and makes popcorn but not very well. Maybe because of my microwave because it is has combi functionality with oven. The product also came a bit crooked and the lid does not fit very well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Wow, what a great idea & works perfectly!
reviews.reviewText: I had to give it 5 mins on 1000 in my microwave before the popping stopped. I didn’t use any oil at all, just seasoning. Verdict, absolutely great !The uniqueness of this microwave popper is that it is constructed from silicone rubber and is completely bendy and collapsible. A free floating lit permits the popped corn to expand without either restricting it or permitting any to escape into the microwave. Easily cleaned either as a hand wash of placing in a dishwasher. As we say “What’s not to like’
Es un producto muy intuitivo de usar y bastante fácil de limpiar. Sirve, además, para que las palomitas sean mucho más sanas.
